children.subject:
Only the fist 25% of 61C covers C programming. The rest covers RISC-V assembly language and parallel computing. The beginning of 162 also goes over some C review.
btw, it sucks that you can't get into a class that is supposed to prepare you for your internships.

Most low level programming interviews I experienced have been a combination of C concept questions, bitwise operations questions, and some random knowledge questions. Depends on the company but I would say try lectures 1-5.

history.content: I have an internship interview for an embedded software internship this summer, and the job description requires programming in C / C++. Unfortunately, I haven't taken CS 61C yet, and can't enroll this semester due to the waitlist. For those who have had internships with low-level programming, did interviews require knowledge of C or did they just test data structures / algorithms? Also, what are the most applicable topics / lectures in CS 61C that I can review to prepare? Thank you.
history.subject: Important topics from CS 61C
